\n To obtain your personal token, fol:
To obtain your personal token, follow these steps:

    1. Log in to your Airtable account.
    2. Visit https://airtable.com/create/tokens/ to create one
    3. Click on "+ Add a base" and select the base you want to use or all bases.
    4. Click on "+ Add a scope" and select "data.records.read", "data.records.write" and "schema.bases.read".
    5. Click on "Create token" and copy the token.

The ID of the record to which you want t: The ID of the record to which you want to upload the file.
The file to be uploaded, which can be pr: The file to be uploaded, which can be provided either as a public file URL or in Base64 encoded format.
Specifies the MIME type of the file bein: Specifies the MIME type of the file being uploaded (e.g., 'image/png', 'application/pdf').
The name of the file as it should appear: The name of the file as it should appear after upload.
The content of the comment. To mention a: The content of the comment. To mention a user, use the format `@[userId]` or `@[userEmail]`.
Optional. The ID of a parent comment to: Optional. The ID of a parent comment to create a threaded reply.
The name for the new base.
Define the tables for the new base. Use: Define the tables for the new base. Use the default value as a template. The first field for each table will be its primary field.
The name for the new table.
An optional description for the new tabl: An optional description for the new table.
A JSON array of fields for the new table: A JSON array of fields for the new table. The first field in the array will become the primary field.
The name or keyword to search for within: The name or keyword to search for within your base names.
The exact name of the table you want to: The exact name of the table you want to find.
Authorization headers are injected autom: Authorization headers are injected automatically from your connection.

Triggers when a new record is added to t: Triggers when a new record is added to the selected table.
Triggers when a record is created or upd: Triggers when a record is created or updated in selected table.
**Last Modified Time** field will be use: **Last Modified Time** field will be used to watch new or updated records.Please create **Last Modified Time** field in your schema,if you don't have any timestamp field.
